subtitle: Hello, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove and today I'd
like to talk about the signal-to-noise
ratio in parapsychology. You know, there's
very little that we really understand
about how psychic functioning works.
We're not aware of any particular organs
in the brain or elsewhere in the body
that are the receptors for extrasensory
perception. We're not aware of any
channel of communication by which this
information can flow from one person to
another or
from a distant location into the brain
and mind of a particular person. Or even,
and especially as a matter of fact,
precognitive information that seems to
travel backwards in time. All of these
things are incredible mysteries. And I
suspect one of the reasons that they are
mysteries is simply because we're
conceptualizing it improperly. It's not
about extra sensory perception it to me,
although it surely mimics that idea. What
we're really talking about is the nature
of time, space, and consciousness itself.
And the mystery occurs because of the
way we're conceiving of consciousness.
But, in spite of all of that, there is one
basic truth that seems to be true,
there's something that we do know about
the receptive abilities - of telepathy,
clairvoyance and precognition - and that
has to do with the signal-to-noise ratio.
it goes back, I suppose, to the Yoga
Sutras, in which it's explained that when
the mind is calm and quiet, like the
surface of a still lake, it can reflect
the external reality perfectly like a
mirror, so to speak. But when the mind is
agitated then you're not going to be a
good receptor because of the signal-
to-noise ratio. If there's too much
noise, how is that weak signal supposed
to get through? So, there's a wide variety
of research that shows that relaxation
exercises, hypnotic processes, guided
meditations, yoga meditation, all of those
things that help quiet your nervous
system are going to create a more
favorable signal-to-noise ratio and
people's scores in tests of extrasensory
perception are going to go up. And that
phenomenon, to my knowledge, has been
replicated over and over again. It's one
of the few very solid findings that we
have in parapsychology other than,
obviously, the existence of the
phenomenon at all. But what we're talking
about here is what is known as
process-oriented research. What do we
know about the process? And the process
is that just like any other form of
perception and communication, the
signal-to-noise ratio is important. There
are other aspects because, of course, we
have some control over our internal
nervous system. We have some measure of
ability to quiet our minds. And one of
those, of course, has to do with your
ethical behavior. If you are engaged in
unethical behavior, your mind is going to
be plagued by guilt, for example, worried
that you might get caught, for example,
perhaps a certain amount of numbness so
that you don't have to feel the pain of
the other people who are being hurt by
your behavior. All of those things are
not helpful. People who engage with a
clear mind and a clear heart are going
to do better. That's
the simple truth of it. Another point is,
though, the environment. If you can find a
quiet place to engage in your practice
of extrasensory perception that's going
to help. And at SRI International, they
had this wonderful, electrically sealed
room - radio signals couldn't pass in and
out of that room. But, for most of us, at
this very moment- our bodies, our nervous
systems - are being bombarded by microwave
signals, and TV signals, and shortwave
radio signals, and cell phone signals, and
Bluetooth signals. And the
electromagnetic environment around most
of us is quite noisy. And there's
research that suggests that the human
nervous system is very sensitive to
these things, especially when it comes to
tests of extra sensory perception. There
are even studies that show that when the
geomagnetic activity of the Earth, and
that's a very weak magnetic activity, but
when there's solar storms, for example, or
when there's high geomagnetic activity,
extrasensory perception tends to decline.
And there's even research, most amazing
research, that suggests that if you do
experiments - projects related to
telepathy, clairvoyance, precognition - if
you do these at what is known as local
Sidereal time - 13 hours and 18 minutes, 13
hours and 30 minutes - there's a peak, that
people's scores in, let's say, remote
viewing tend to increase around 400% if
the experiments or tests or projects are
conducted at that time. Now, local
Sidereal time is different than normal
clock time. Clock time is based, of course,
on the movements
of the Sun on a 24-hour day. But Sidereal
time is the relationship of the earth to,
not to the Sun, to the Stars. And the
Sidereal day is four minutes shorter
each day than the normal calendar day. So
local Sidereal time changes every day in
relationship to clock time. And the
intriguing thing is it appears that at
that time around 13 hours and 30 minutes
local Sidereal time which, of course,
depends on your location as as well, but
what it means is that the center of the
galaxy will be on the horizon, it will
not be directly overhead, it will not be
directly under your feet either, it'll be
on the horizon. And it's possible that
there are signals coming from the center
of our galaxy which is, supposedly, these
days cosmologists think contains
a black hole - a big black hole - and not
only that the black hole is emitting
positrons - particles that travel
backwards through time. Now, we have no
idea how any of that might be affecting
your nervous system or why the
center of the galaxy being on the
horizon is a special location that would
be favorable to psychic functioning. And
it may turn out, as a matter of fact, that
over time this effect will have turned
out to have been an artifact of some
sort. But right now the data is pointing
in that direction. So if you are
interested in absolutely enhancing your
psychic functioning it's important to
pay attention to it. You can actually get
apps for your cell phone that will
calculate local Sidereal time for you.
And some of them are designed for remote
viewers, and so they'll tell you what is
the best time a day every day for you to
engage in psychic functioning. But the
main lesson, of course,
is to find a quiet place. If you have
access to an electrically shielded place,
all the better. So that's my lesson for
today. Those are the thoughts I'd like to
leave you with: the signal-to-noise ratio
in Parapsychology. How can you put that
to use in your life? I think there might
be many ways even outside of the
parapsychological domain. Thank you for
being with me.
